title: Aussies Forecast To Spend $804 Each During Black Friday Sales | 10 News+
description: Around 6 million Australians are expected to take part in Black Friday sales, spending an average of $804 each. Despite the pull of bargain hunting, consumer advocates such as CHOICE are telling shoppers to think twice before they buy, with more than 50 per cent of Aussies saying they have regretted a purchase made in the Black Friday sales. title: Retired Nationals Senator John 'Wacka' Williams Reacts To Barnaby Joyce’s Departure | 10 News+
description: After Barnaby Joyce’s departure from the Nationals and sandwich-pressed steak dinner with Pauline Hanson, suggesting he might be bound for One Nation, his former colleagues have been giving mixed responses. Senator Bridget McKenzie claimed any siding with Pauline Hanson would be an act of betrayal, while Matt Canavan wants Joyce back in the fold. Joining 10 News+ is retired Nationals Senator and party elder John 'Wacka' Williams to give his thoughts. title: Survivor Of Previous Shark Attack Reacts To Tragic Death Of Tourist On NSW Beach | 10 News+
description: After surviving a shark attack in 2011, Dave Pearson started the ‘Bite Club’, a support group for victims of similar incidents. He spoke to 10 News+ after one person died and another was hospitalised after a shark attack on the NSW mid north coast yesterday. title: Bite Club For Shark Attack Survivors & South Pole Speed Record | 10 News+
description: Yesterday, the E-Safety Commissioner announced that Aussies will be blocked from three services that have been used to 'nudify' unsuspecting victims. The websites work by using artificial intelligence to edit images of real people, including children, to appear naked. title: Melbourne Airport Fire, Europe Prepares For War, Trump Threatens Venezuela | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – Melbourne airport has been evacuated after a fire broke out in one of the domestic terminals, France is introducing a voluntary military service plan as Europe braces for new threats from Russia, the US has threatened land strikes on Venezuela as tensions escalate between the two countries, Australian parliament wraps up for the year and why some Italians thought they were visited by aliens. title: Europe Braces Amid Threats From Russia, France Introduced Voluntary Military Service | 10 News
description: Europe is shifting closer towards a war footing, with France unveiling a new national military service plan targeting teenagers. President Emmanuel Macron says his country needs to mobilise and must be ready to defend itself, confirming a limited form of voluntary military service will be re-introduced, aimed at young people. title: Trump Calls Reporter Stupid Over D.C. Shooting | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump lashed out at a reporter during a press conference, calling her “stupid” after being challenged over his claims about Biden-era vetting failures linked to the Washington, D.C. shooting.  A National Guard member died after being ambushed near the White House, an attack authorities say was carried out by an Afghan national.  The journalist cited a watchdog report showing Afghans were vetted by US agencies, prompting Trump to double down.  He insisted the previous administration was to blame, saying they “let him in” and called the reporter a “stupid person". title: Blasts Hit Sanctioned Tankers Off Turkish Coast | 10 News
description: Explosions rocked two sanctioned tankers from Russia’s shadow fleet in the Black Sea near the Bosphorus Strait, with Turkish authorities releasing vision of flames and thick smoke billowing from the tanker Kairos.  Turkey’s Transport Ministry said Kairos reported an “external impact” before catching fire, with all 25 crew members rescued as emergency vessels rushed to the scene.  A second tanker, Virat, was also reportedly struck further east, with heavy smoke detected but its 20 crew “in good condition”.  Both vessels were sailing under sanctions linked to Russia’s war in Ukraine, amid ongoing risks from drifting mines in the region. title: Sri Lanka Cyclone Ditwah Leaves Dozens Dead As Rescues Continue Amid Worsening Floods | 10 News
description: Cyclone Ditwah has swept across Sri Lanka, killing 46 people and leaving 23 missing as floods and landslides hit eastern and central regions after more than 300 millimetres of rain.  Around 44,000 people have been affected, with thousands sheltering in schools and public centres, according to the Disaster Management Centre.  Rescue teams airlifted families from rooftops, including 13 people trapped on a bridge in Polonnaruwa and a man stranded atop a coconut tree.  Officials warn flooding is expected to worsen over the next 12 hours, including in parts of Colombo. title: Global Airbus A320 Grounding Triggers Widespread Flight Disruptions | 10 News
description: The most popular passenger airplane ever built has been grounded across the globe.  The snap decision sent our airlines into a frenzy, forcing the cancellation of dozens of flights and delaying hundreds more.  Airbus says planes in the A320 family are struggling with the intensity of sun radiation, which is corrupting the data that helps keep planes in the sky. description: A freak gust of wind has ruined a day out on a jumping castle in Sydney's south-west.  Five children are recovering after the inflatable was hurled several metres into the air.
